intro: Sauvagesia guianensis var. araracuarensis, commonly known as the Araracuarensis sauvagesia, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. This variety is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
